articles.headline: Airlines cancel more than 3,000 flights on Monday, a busy holiday travel day.
articles.snippet: A storm in the Washington area knocked out power to hundreds of thousands of people, adding to the problems facing airlines, like staff shortages.
articles.abstract: A storm in the Washington area knocked out power to hundreds of thousands of people, adding to the problems facing airlines, like staff shortages.
articles.lead_paragraph: This is supposed to be a year of revival for airlines. It’s off to a rough start.

articles.headline: Apple Becomes First Company to Hit $3 Trillion Market Value
articles.snippet: The iPhone maker’s value tripled since 2018 as its sales continued to soar and it spent hundreds of billions of dollars on its own stock.
articles.abstract: The iPhone maker’s value tripled since 2018 as its sales continued to soar and it spent hundreds of billions of dollars on its own stock.
articles.lead_paragraph: Combine Walmart, Disney, Netflix, Nike, Exxon Mobil, Coca-Cola, Comcast, Morgan Stanley, McDonald’s, AT&T, Goldman Sachs, Boeing, IBM and Ford.

articles.headline: Democrats Blast Corporate Profits as Inflation Surges
articles.snippet: Politicians are placing more blame on greedy companies as prices stay high. But booming consumer demand is enabling firms to charge more.
articles.abstract: Politicians are placing more blame on greedy companies as prices stay high. But booming consumer demand is enabling firms to charge more.
articles.lead_paragraph: Inflation remains rapid as the economy enters 2022, and Democrats have begun pointing to a new culprit for the high and lasting price increases: Greedy corporations.

articles.headline: Another Far-Right Group Is Scrutinized About Its Efforts to Aid Trump
articles.snippet: The organization, called 1st Amendment Praetorian, is not as well known as the Oath Keepers or the Proud Boys, but it worked closely with pro-Trump forces in the months after the 2020 election.
articles.abstract: The organization, called 1st Amendment Praetorian, is not as well known as the Oath Keepers or the Proud Boys, but it worked closely with pro-Trump forces in the months after the 2020 election.
articles.lead_paragraph: Days after a pro-Trump mob stormed the Capitol on Jan. 6 last year, federal law enforcement officials pursued two high-profile extremist groups: the far-right nationalist Proud Boys and the Oath Keepers militia. Members of both organizations were quickly arrested on attention-grabbing charges, accused of plotting to interfere with the certification of the 2020 vote count.

articles.headline: Elizabeth Holmes is found guilty of four counts of fraud.
articles.snippet: The case against the founder of the failed blood testing start-up Theranos came to symbolize the pitfalls of Silicon Valley’s culture of hustle and hype.
articles.abstract: The case against the founder of the failed blood testing start-up Theranos came to symbolize the pitfalls of Silicon Valley’s culture of hustle and hype.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN JOSE, Calif. — Elizabeth Holmes, the founder of the failed blood testing start-up Theranos, was found guilty of four of 11 charges of fraud on Monday, in a case that came to symbolize the pitfalls of Silicon Valley’s culture of hustle, hype and greed.
articles.byline: By Erin Griffith and Erin Woo

articles.headline: ‘It’s Chaos’ as Schools Confront Omicron
articles.snippet: After an unrelenting spike in cases, a small but growing list of districts — including Newark, Atlanta, Milwaukee and Cleveland — moved temporarily to remote learning.
articles.abstract: After an unrelenting spike in cases, a small but growing list of districts — including Newark, Atlanta, Milwaukee and Cleveland — moved temporarily to remote learning.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Omicron surge threatens to upend any sense of peace in the nation’s education system.

articles.headline: The Epic Rise and Fall of Elizabeth Holmes
articles.snippet: In Silicon Valley’s world of make-believe, the philosophy of “fake it until you make it” finally gets its comeuppance.
articles.abstract: In Silicon Valley’s world of make-believe, the philosophy of “fake it until you make it” finally gets its comeuppance.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Near the end of Elizabeth Holmes’s criminal trial, her lawyers submitted into evidence her punishing self-improvement plan.

articles.headline: A Widening Web of Undersea Cables Connects Britain to Green Energy
articles.snippet: Linking one nation’s power grid with another’s is considered essential as more electricity is generated from solar and wind.
articles.abstract: Linking one nation’s power grid with another’s is considered essential as more electricity is generated from solar and wind.
articles.lead_paragraph: BLYTH, England — Britain’s economic and political ties to Europe may be fraying, but a growing web of undersea electrical cables binds the nation’s vital power system and its clean energy aspirations to the continent.

articles.headline: Office Attire That Makes a Statement: ‘OK, Let’s Hug’
articles.snippet: Employers are desperate to figure out a way to safely get employees back to their desks. Enter the humble wristband.
articles.abstract: Employers are desperate to figure out a way to safely get employees back to their desks. Enter the humble wristband.
articles.lead_paragraph: Leah McGowen-Hare wants you to know one thing about her: She is a hugger. If you just met, she’ll give you a hug. If you are a Salesforce client, she’ll give you a hug. If you are considering signing up for Salesforce’s services, then you, too, are in line for a hug. She extended a virtual hug in the middle of a recent video call.

articles.headline: Hollywood Glamour Is Pandemic-Proof at the Polo Lounge
articles.snippet: A clubby gathering spot attracts a who’s who of the film industry, and reminds them of a time when movies were still king.
articles.abstract: A clubby gathering spot attracts a who’s who of the film industry, and reminds them of a time when movies were still king.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Hollywood is down in the dumps. Oscar hopefuls like “King Richard,” “Nightmare Alley” and “West Side Story” have sputtered, and everyone knows that, studio spin aside, the Omicron variant is only partly to blame.

articles.headline: Silicon Valley Can’t Escape Elizabeth Holmes
articles.snippet: Ms. Holmes, the founder of Theranos, wasn’t a creature of Silicon Valley, or so the refrain went. But her fraud trial showed otherwise.
articles.abstract: Ms. Holmes, the founder of Theranos, wasn’t a creature of Silicon Valley, or so the refrain went. But her fraud trial showed otherwise.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN JOSE, Calif. — In 2016, start-up founders sang, “Theranos doesn’t represent, we are better,” in a holiday video created by the venture capital firm First Round Capital.

articles.headline: Faced With Questions About Forced Labor in China, the I.O.C. Is Tight-Lipped
articles.snippet: Olympic officials are reluctant to look into whether any Beijing 2022 merchandise might have been made under duress by Uyghurs, an activist group charges.
articles.abstract: Olympic officials are reluctant to look into whether any Beijing 2022 merchandise might have been made under duress by Uyghurs, an activist group charges.
articles.lead_paragraph: The activists’ request was straightforward: They wanted to share their concerns about human rights in China, in particular the possibility that official merchandise for the Beijing Olympics was being made with forced labor, and to hear what the International Olympic Committee was doing to ensure it was not.

articles.headline: More quit jobs than ever, but most turnover is in low-wage work.
articles.snippet: Government data for November shows the continuing disruption of the coronavirus in the labor market.
articles.abstract: Government data for November shows the continuing disruption of the coronavirus in the labor market.
articles.lead_paragraph: The number of Americans quitting their jobs is the highest on record, as workers take advantage of strong employer demand to pursue better opportunities.

articles.headline: Toyota Topped G.M. in U.S. Car Sales in 2021, a First for a Foreign Automaker
articles.snippet: After struggling to produce cars because of a global computer chip shortage, automakers are trying to move quickly to making electric vehicles.
articles.abstract: After struggling to produce cars because of a global computer chip shortage, automakers are trying to move quickly to making electric vehicles.
articles.lead_paragraph: Toyota Motor unseated General Motors as the top-selling automaker in the United States last year, becoming the first manufacturer based outside the country to achieve that feat in the industry’s nearly 120-year history.
